intro: Hieracium neoclosianum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat, disk-like structure. It is an invasive species in some regions, outcompeting native plants and altering local ecosystems.
